newsitem.title: UK: C&W Comms gains on positive press comment.
newsitem.headline: C&W Comms gains on positive press comment.

text.p: Shares in Cable & Wireless Communications Plc and other UK cable companies rose on Friday as a report in the Wall Street Journal said the sector was gaining favour with investors, dealers said.
C&W Communications shares were up 6-1/2p to 300 by 0851 GMT in volume of 825,800 shares, after earlier rising as high as 302p -- their highest level since flotation on April 28.
Other cable companies were also firm, with Telewest Communications Plc up 1p to 94-1/2 and General Cable Plc up 3-1/2 to 160-1/2 in thin trade of 38,000.

The Journal highlighted recent positive analyst comment on the cable television sector and said Microsoft Corp's $1 billion bid for an 11.5 percent stake in Comcast Corp had also excited interest in the sector.
